item.title: How can i make f capes unstackable
item.dc:creator: @352scape 352scape
item.description:
@352scape wrote:

[quote=“itzkyle, post:4, topic:156066”]ok in item.java find

[code] try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File(“data/stackable.dat”));
while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
if (c == 0)
itemStackable[counter] = false;
else
itemStackable[counter] = true;
counter++;
}
try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File(“data/stackable.dat”));
while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
if (c == 0)
itemStackable[counter] = false;
else
itemStackable[counter] = true;
counter++;
}
itemStackable[####] = false; ADD THIS HERE make it true to stack it
em

		dataIn.close();
	} catch (IOException e) {
		System.out.println("Critical error while loading stackabledata! Trace:");
		e.printStackTrace();
	}


dataIn.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
System.out.println(“Critical error while loading stackabledata! Trace:”);
e.printStackTrace();
}
[/code][/quote]

i thank u for trying but i tried that and that wont work lol , isnt there like someting like this

public int unstackable{####,####,####};

or something like that :[br][size=1]Posted on: November 01, 2007, 02:19:44 PM[/size][hr]ugh soz about bumping , but cmon people i know this is no-where near rocket science -.-
